newsitem.title: UK: UK decision on EMU won't be easy - Labour's Beckett.
newsitem.headline: UK decision on EMU won't be easy - Labour's Beckett.

text.p: Margaret Beckett, trade and industry spokeswoman for the opposition Labour party, said a decision on whether Britain should join a single European currency would not be easy.
In an interview with BBC radio, she said Labour had no objection in principle to the creation of a single currency.

"The great nightmare for Britain has always been that our economy would not be sufficiently strong for it to be an easy option for us to choose whether or not to join, depending on what we think of the package when we actually see it," she said.

"Our great fear is that the project will go ahead, politically driven, in a way that will make it difficult for Britain if we do join and difficult if we don't. That is part of the reality of the record of this government -- that Britain seems unlikely to be strong enough for that to be an easy decision."
Asked if she was dubious about whether membership would be in Britain's interest, Beckett replied:
"Everybody is worried that the single currency could definitely have some advantages, but if we approach it in the wrong way it could have some serious disadvantages.
Unfortunately, Britain's economy is not so strong that that seems likely to be an easy decision for us." REUTER
